b: ^You remeber last time, that around now Timothy ran off into your shared room to have a breakdown.

MailCall: ^I walk past the commons area, seeing a decent gathering of people.
^Max apperes to be the center of attention, holding a small pile of mail in their hands.
^, there you are. I'm just doin' a mail call."
^"The front desk has been siting on these letters for a while, and some people haven't been picking there's up, so I'm just handing them all out."
^Max hands off a good chunk of them off to Eduardo, whose letters made up more than 60% of the stack.
^[Eduardo] "Eh, my family, probably. they are very old fashioned. they have my number. They could just call me."
^[Isaac] "Maybe they don't want to talk with you?"
^[Max] "and Isaac, here's yours. they also seem to be from your folks."
^Max hands Isaac about half of the mail that was left.
^"Oh, um... I guess I don't have any mail for you."
^[Charlotte] "makes sense. I check the front desk everyday in my routine."
^"Besides, my family hasn't attempted to contact me in a while. Not out of disdain, mind you. There is simply nothing left to say at this juncture."
^[Trissa] "That's an rather odd comment to make Lotty."
^[Trissa] "Eh, nevermind. It's not my place to pry into your personal life."
^[Max] "And Trissa, I've got one letter for you."
^[Trissa] "Oh? Is it from my lil bro Spencer?"
^"Thank You Max. I really apperiecate it!"
^Trissa says that as she cherrily takes the letter, and begins tearing it to shreds. @She Tosses the shreads into the lit fireplace for good measure.
^Max seems to either not notice this, or not care, as they continue handing out letters to the residence
^[Max] "And, Timothy, we got one letter from your folks that had just came in when I grabbed the mail pile."
^Timothy looks at envelope for a bit, not even attempting to open it, before walking away with it in hand.

b: ^because of you know the future, and Timothy's future breakdown, you can choose to follow timothy as he slings away from the conversation
^You don't notice timothy's quiet sadness, as he slinks off.

IgnorantBliss: ^Max stands before me, only a small handful of letters left to hand out.
^[Max] "Oh well, I suppose your friends and family won't be needing to write you letters anymore anyways."
^"All that's left is the weekend, and you'll be out of here. Isn't that exciting?"
^Max's enthusiasm unfortuanly places some undo stress on me.
^but off that topic, I look around and see most everyone from the 2nd floor have scattered, just leaving the usuals lounging around.

c: ^I walk over to Charlotte, who seems to be staring intently at the other residents.
^I walk over towards Trissa, who is leaning by the fireplace, with her nose in that book.
^I walk over to Eduardo, who is rapidly tearing through his pile of letters.
^I walk over to Isaac, neatly sorting his stack of letters.

g-0: ^Feeling all socialed out, I head off.

ClosedWound: ^You follow Timothy, who heads back to your bedroom
^He's curled up on his bed, the letter he got, opened up on his room

b: ^should you try to comfort him, or go get someone more capable?

PoorStitches: ^You do not feel comfortable handling this on your own. best to get Max. Their at least paid for this.
